job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Bangor, ME
pros: Amazing team, paid well, good leadership
cons: there are no downsides to working at SJH

review_title: Wonderful Company, No gimmicks, professional and friendly.
pros:
I have no complaints about working there. They treated me with the highest dignity and respect, no "rah-rah" sessions and other HR "gimmicks." I felt included from day one with the staff I worked with, my input was always positively acknowledged, very business-professional and friendly business atmosphere. 

I was unfortunately furloughed and layed off due to the Covid-19 pandemic (financial burden due to the logistics of the pandemic), BUT I was treated with dignity, and the compensation, etc to help me through that helped tremendously, and I would go back there if/when they recover.
cons: I have no Cons. Anything I may have rated 3 stars or below (ex:Career Opportunities" ) were rated lower for they were based what is/was available during the pandemic.

pros: The staff, management, and even President/CEO treat you AMAZING. The mission statement is clear cut - we take care of our community AND our own (coworkers). From the hiring process, orientation, to working independently, I don't have one negative thing to say about St. Joes. It is hands down the best place for CNA work in there area where you are appreciated, respected, and viewed as an equal among nurses and doctors.
cons: The only downside about working at St. Joes is the pay for CNAs. It is one of the lowest paying CNA jobs in the area.

pros: This is the best place to work and now that it was bought by Covenant health, it has increased our pay.
cons: It is a small hospital, so unfortunately we cannot take all patients who require specialized care.

pros: Benefits and pay are better than other security jobs in the area.
cons: Understaffed due to pandemic but that is all places.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in Bangor, ME
pros: flexible, follow their mission statement, really care about their patients
cons: understaffed, but so is all healthcare currently.

Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Bangor, ME
pros: Treated like you are part of a family
great to work with in this field
cons: long hours are required without overtime pay

pros: A full time job to go to
cons: Low pay for all the work they give

review_title: Decent benefits, underpaid and in need of management improvement
pros: Benefits, especially earned time was above average and not too costly.
cons: Management not professional in timely communication. Lower than market value even with experience.

review_title: I would work for this hospital any day!
job_title: Inpatient and Outpatient Staff Nurse in Bangor, ME
pros: skilled staff, amazing team-oriented environment, lack of employee hierarchy (doctors, nurses, admin, ancillary staff may sit together at lunch, etc.), competitive wages, exceptional housekeeping
cons: some may feel a lack of a nurse's Union would be; there was the expectation to float to other floors/departments (med-surg to ICU,etc.), which is not only stressful but questionable for patient safety

Lack of management, lack of team work, negative feedback and little positive feedback, expensive health benefits, no paid holidays (you must use your EARNED time), only 3 paid days off when a loved one passes away

pros: Very friendly staff and atmosphere. I love working here.
cons: Sometimes we don't get a 15-min break time because we have to help each other. When you have nothing to do, you have to go another floor to help out, so you end up not getting any break. However, there are a lot of time we can sit with patients.

pros: The team environment is wonderful, and the staff is so friendly.  Coming from an outside perspective I have felt very welcome in the hospital.
cons: Sometimes we have someone call out sick which is understandable, but it can really throw a big kink into the workload the rest of the crew has to take on.

pros: management always has your back, help is always available
cons: pay could be higher, benefits are not the best

pros: Teamwork is great. Coworkers all get along.
cons: Not paid enough. Equipment breaks a lot.
Very bad health insurance benefits and 403B plan.
